Posts.Content: Oct 29, 2008 08:02AM CarmenA wrote: Hey Steph, Such a hard question, but I'm sure we all thought of it few times, and each time the answer was different based on how we felt at the moment.  I think when the time comes the decision will be clear and more merciful.  For now let's all live and love life for as long as we can.  Be grateful for the simple abundance of life.   love, hugs and prayers being sent your way Steph, hang in there kido. Carmen

Posts.Content: CarmenA wrote: Hello everyone, to give you all a fast recap of my history! first DX B/C Ocotober,2006, stage III - HER2+, did AC/T for 4 months every 2 weeks, then Herceptin for a year. Also did 21 sessions of Rad.  Learned of extensive Mets. to the lungs, liver and verterbral, as of Oct. 17th 2008, "last week".  This time the treatment combination is Taxotere/Herceptin.  I'm wondering if any of you going through same or similar DX and/or treatment. Love to all Caramel Type:Ductal Carcinoma - Invasive Carcinoma - Grade 2 - 2/13 nodes positive - stage III ERpostive 1- PR negative HER2+ / Mastect . Mets to lungs, liver and spine. I say, a day is not promised and, one day at a time is all we can do anyways. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: New to this forum! CarmenA AusAla

Posts.Content: Oct 27, 2008 06:32PM CarmenA wrote: Hey LuAnn, Thanks for the kind welcoming words, it's amazing how we can bare this monster and go on with our lives in stride.  So glad to hear you're doing well 2 1/2 years into mts dx.  Keep it up. P.S sorry for the name change, still editing and fixing up the mock ups I make.  Boys tell me I should spare humanity and stay away from the PC. ...lol.  buggers. Love, Carmen Carmen
Posts.Title: New to this forum! CarmenA AusAla

Posts.Content: Oct 28, 2008 09:58AM CarmenA wrote: Hey Becky, Thanks for your welcome and support, and the prayers much needed.  Seems that your kids are close in age as mine, I have 2 boys 20 & 17.  Single mom no hubby, was married for 11 years that took a lot from me. and just one day woke up and decided that's it not putting up with it no more. That was about 10 years ago. Very selfish/ self centered man and that's just one of the sicotic qualities, example; yesterday was my oldest B/day and his dad didn't talk to him for about a month now, cos the day he was moving to a new place my oldest didn't go to help as agreed upon with dad.  So I called the ex up in the evening and asked him if he sent B/day greetings to his son.  His reply no and will not this is a rude kid and selfish and if I can't find him in my time of need he's dead to me.  I'm a sick man, I've got diabities to deal with, and a high blood presure, I don't need to deal with this.  Here I am kicking myself thinking what was I thinking calling him asking him to be a dad and above all be Human and loving towards his kids.  I don't think he heard any wisde/ parenting words I said.  I worry to death, what will happen to the boys in the case something happens to me, specially the 17 years old!  but I guess as mothers we will never stop worring till we hit the board.

Posts.Content: Oct 27, 2008 09:41PM CarmenA wrote: Thank you all, for your warm welcome to the "survival club", it's getting me emotional, then again emotions are running a bit high this week with everything that's going on and having to process all of it, in such short time. If there's any saving grace in this journey .. it's the overwhelming compassion one shall receives when one asks for it. At the drop of a hat we're all willing to put our agonies, pains and bad days on the back burner to be completely there for someone else having a hard time going through this trying journey. Love and prayers to you all, Carmen
